page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT IN COSHESTON
page.content: Before the War, Cosheston people worked mainly on the land. Since the growth of the village due to the building of modern private houses, the work patterns people have changed. Today, very few of the villagers work on the land. Most of them work either at the nearby oil refineries, the Power Station or in Pembroke or Pembroke Dock. Although there is very bad unemployment in Pembroke Dock, Cosheston does not seem badly affected by it. Of the 17 schoolchildren we inter- viewed in Cosheston School, 3 had fathers who were unemployed. 6 worked in the refineries, 1 at the Power Station and the rest worked in Pembroke Dock. None were farmers. Of the children's mothers, 6 worked.More Pembroke Dock mothers had jobs than Cosheston mothers.
